Bag O' Links - 14/8/2009

  • Stupid ruby tricks – ThoughtBot are having fun. so am i.
  • CSS buttons FTW – nice tutorials on how to create buttons, of course you can use the silky_buttons plugin if you are on Rails.
  • Rails BugMash on ’What is new in Rails – i guess my commits weren’t as important as the others.. oh well, next time. :)
  • Limerick – useful rake tasks from ThoughtBot – Most welcome, useful as hell.
  • Rails Metal example – track statistics – another example from Charles.
  • Index your associations – a little bit of tweaking, a lot more happiness.

GitHub Treasures

  • mile_marker – mark html elements with the milestone they are related to. (hmm?)
  • inherited_resources – Inherited Resources speeds up development by making your controllers inherit all restful actions so you just have to focus on what is important.
  • rubaidhstrano – a collection of standard Capistrano recipes, all rolled into one place (credit: Mike Gunderloy)
  • superdeploy – and another collection of those. (credit: Mike Gunderloy)
  • wice_grid – a rails plugin to create grids, including pagination, sorting and other fun stuff.
  • Alfred – IRC butler.
  • rails_sql_views – not the best name, but it enables view creation via migrations.
